original_title: Manhattan: Duane Street - City Hall Place
text:
(1) Duane Street, east from and including City Hall Place, to but not including Park Row. This view shows "St. Andrew's" Roman Catholic Church on the N.E. corner of Duane Street and City Hall Place. September 24, 1927.
, P. L. Sperr.

(2) The same, five years later, showing the clearance for the new Federal Courts Building. October 22, 1932.
P. L. Sperr.

(3) The same as No. 1 and showing a farther view to Park Row. Adjoining the church are No's. 25 and 29 Duane Street, the 6-story and corner building being No. 100 Park Row. St. Andrews R.C. Church was originally a Congregational organization (1808) which was succeeded by a Methodist group. It was used for some years as a wine house. The present group first occupied the premises in 1842. A falling wall of an adjacent building damaged the property in 1875. October 1928.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

for further information, see The New York Post : Wednesday Sept. 8, 1937.

original_title: Manhattan: Duane Street - City Hall Place
text:
(1)  Duane Street, north side, east from and including City Hall Place, to but not including Park Row, as seen from Chambers Street, in the foreground. The St. Andrew's Catholic Church is seen on the S.E. corner of City Hall Place and Duane Street.

February 24, 1929.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)  The same, three years later.

October 22, 1932.

P. L. Sperr.

(3)  The Church under demolition, prior to the construction upon this site, of a new edifice. Note the changed background in this view; Municipal and Federal structures surrounding same and forming a Civic Centre on Foley Square.

January 27, 1938.

P. L. Sperr.

original_title: Manhattan: City Hall Place - Duane Street
text:
20 City Hall Place, adjoining the N.W. corner of Duane Street, as seen from Pearl Street, and thru clearance for the new Federal Courts Building. This is the parish house of St. Andrew's R.C. Church.

April 28, 1932.

P. L. Sperr.

original_title: Manhattan: City Hall Place - Duane Street
text:
(1) City Hall Place, west side, north from but not including Duane, to but not including Pearl Streets. Site for the new Federal Courts Building being cleared. Building in the process of demolition is the old Department of Health Building, as seen from the rear.

January 20, 1932.

P. L. Sperr.

(2) The same view, showing site completely razed.

March 14, 1932.

P. L. Sperr.

(3) The same view, from a later date.

April 28, 1932.

P. L. Sperr.

ASSUMING STREET TO BE NORTH AND SOUTH

original_title: Manhattan: Duane Street - City Hall Place
text:
(1) Duane Street, north side, east from but not including City Hall Place, to and including Cardinal Place, as seen from Chambers Street, in the foreground. St. Andrew's Roman Catholic Church is in the center. January 20, 1932.

P. L. Sperr.

(2) The same, showing Chambers Street. July 1932.

P. L. Sperr.

(3) The same, from a different angle. October 22, 1932.

P. L. Sperr.
